content: Continuing the trend of copying all the good things the Compiler team does, maybe we should consider an experts map for the standard library? https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/blob/master/content/experts/map.toml
I think that would cover what I was hoping to achieve by setting up project groups around key APIs like iterator and ip so we have people familiar with those areas to ping

Ok, so I've been thinking about this and thought we could do another survey, maybe posted to internals or something that looked something like:

  • What areas of the standard library do you contribute to? (Write down all the modules or types you contribute to) <- Maybe just a big checklist here?
  • How would you rate your level of expertise with these areas?
  • Would you like to be pinged/involved with any changes to these areas?
  • What platforms do you work on?

I think there was a contributor survey that went out a little while ago (can't remember exactly what was on it :sweat_smile:). But the idea here being trying to get an idea of what areas of std we have experts in and using that to bootstrap an experts map. Alternatives could be to look at git history or even just ask for volunteers :smile:
